  • havoc.autoval.tests.caterr_injection.caterr_injection

Source code for havoc.autoval.tests.caterr_injection.caterr_injection

from __future__ import absolute_import
from __future__ import division
from __future__ import print_function
from __future__ import unicode_literals
from havoc.autoval.lib.test_base import TestBase
from havoc.autoval.lib.host.host import Host
from havoc.autotest_testfiles.validation_utils.lib.autoval import AutovalUtils
from datetime import datetime

"""
    # Supported Error Types
    IERR raw command
    0x0a 0x44 0 0 2 0 0 0 0 0x40 0x00 0x04 0x07 0xeb 0x6f 0x00 0xff 0xff
    MCERR raw command
    0x0a 0x44 0 0 2 0 0 0 0 0x40 0x00 0x04 0x07 0xeb 0x6f 0x0b 0xff 0xff
"""



[docs]class CatErrINJectionCheck(TestBase):


[docs]    def __init__(self):
        super(CatErrINJectionCheck, self).__init__()
        self.count = self.test_control["count"]
        self.caterr_ierr = self.test_control.get('caterr_ierr', False)
        self.caterr_mcerr = self.test_control.get('caterr_mcerr', False)



[docs]    def execute(self):
        self.log_info("This is CATERR INJection Test")
        for each_count in range(1, self.count + 1):
            self.log_info("Number of error count induced %s" % (each_count))

            self.log_info("Induce the CATERR")
            timestamp_now = datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M')

            #Injection of CATERR
            if self.caterr_ierr:
                current_reboot = self.host.get_last_reboot()
                caterr_type = "IERR"
                self.host.inject_ierr_caterr()
                # Power reset occurs after caterr ierr, wait for reconnect.
                AutovalUtils.log_info("Power Reset occurred after CATERR"
                        " IERR INJection")
                self.host.system_health_check(current_reboot, 1200)


                self.post_injection(timestamp_now)
            elif self.caterr_mcerr:
                caterr_type = "MCERR"
                self.host.inject_mcerr_caterr()
                self.post_injection(timestamp_now)
            else:
                self.validate_condition(False, "Invalid input")

            self.validate_condition(True, "CATERR %s injected, Iter %d Completed"
                                    % (caterr_type, each_count))



[docs]    def post_injection(self, timestamp_now):
        # Wait for the crashdump to get collected
        out = self.host.oob.check_sel_log_caterr(timestamp_now)

        # If collection of crashdump is confirmed
        # collect the crashdump
        if out:
            self.log_info("Collecting crashdump from mnt path")
            self.host.oob.collect_dump(self.system_log_dir)
        else:
            self.log_info("crash dump did not create %s" % (out))

        # Inducing caterr will lose host connection
        # Get the connection back up by power cycle
        self.host.oob.ac_cycle()



[docs]    def cleanup(self):
        super(CatErrINJectionCheck, self).cleanup(cfg_filter=['log_util'])



[docs]    def on_fail(self):
        super(CatErrINJectionCheck, self).on_fail(config_check=True, caterr=True)



[docs]def main():
    test = CatErrINJectionCheck()
    test.lifecycle()



if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()
